meanings.definition: The act of protecting or guarding against attack or injury.
meanings.sent1: The defensing of the castle walls kept the villagers safe from invaders.
meanings.sent2: The defensing of the goal by the goalkeeper prevented the opposing team from scoring.
meanings.sent3: The knight's defensing of the kingdom was so thorough that even the dragons couldn't breach the defenses.
meanings.sent4: Her defensing of her heart was like a fortress, impenetrable to any romantic advances.
meanings.sent5: The defensing of the treasure was so intense that even the most cunning thieves couldn't get near it.

meanings.definition: The act of defending or justifying a position or argument.
meanings.sent1: His defensing of his controversial opinion sparked a heated debate among the group.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer's defensing of her client's innocence convinced the jury of his non-guilt.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's defensing of his absurd jokes left the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent4: Her defensing of her beliefs was like a shield against any doubts or criticisms.
meanings.sent5: The politician's defensing of his policies was so convincing that even his opponents had to acknowledge their merit.
